titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Pasteur Institute (University of Michigan)

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

archdesc.bioghist: Established in 1903 to counter a rabies outbreak, the institute was the only public clinic in Michigan until 1925. The bulk of work was examining animals for suspected rabies.
archdesc.scopecontent: Record books, 1903-1905 and 1907, of treatment given patients bitten by dogs and other animals; and receipt books of rabies specimens received by the institute with diagnosis of each specimen, 1915-1916 and 1951-1953.
